SCRCdataAPI 1.17.1
  • Reference

Upload paper metadata to the data registry

Source: R/upload_paper.R
upload_paper.Rd

Upload paper metadata to the data registry

upload_paper(
  title,
  authors,
  journal,
  journal_abbreviation,
  journal_website,
  release_date,
  abstract,
  keywords,
  doi,
  primary_not_supplement = TRUE,
  version = "1.0.0",
  key
)

Arguments

title

a string specifying the title of the paper e.g. "Covid-19: A systemic disease treated with a wide-ranging approach: A case report"
authors

a string specifying the authors e.g. "Massabeti, Rosanna and Cipriani, Maria Stella and Valenti, Ivana"
journal

a string specifying the full journal name e.g. "Journal of Population Therapeutics and Clinical Pharmacology"
journal_abbreviation

a string specifying the journal abbreviation e.g. "J Popul Ther Clin Pharmacol"
journal_website

a string specifying the journal homepage e.g. "https://www.jptcp.com/index.php/jptcp"
release_date

a POSIXct of format "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" specifying the release date of the paper e.g. as.POSIXct("2020-01-01 12:00:00", format = "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
abstract

a string specifying the abstract e.g. "At the end of December 2019, the Health Commission of the"
keywords

a string specifying keywords or keyphrases seperated by "and", e.g. "covid-19 and coronavirus disease and monoclonal antibodies

  • and non-invasive mechanical ventilation and treatment"
doi

a string specifying the doi e.g. "10.15586/jptcp.v27iSP1.691"
primary_not_supplement

(optional) an object of class logical where TRUE is the primary source (default) and false is a supplement
version

(optional) a string specifying the version number; by default this is 1.0.0 (assuming a published paper), set to 0.1.0 for a preprint
key

API token from data.scrc.uk

See also

Other upload functions: upload_data_product(), upload_github_repo(), upload_object_links(), upload_source_data(), upload_submission_script(), upload_toml_to_github()
